channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Liverpool 'united as one' after Salah return - Van Dijk
item.description: Virgil van Dijk says Liverpool "are absolutely united and go forward as one" after Mohamed Salah returned to the squad for Saturday's win over Brighton.

item.title: Why Sunderland v Newcastle means so much
item.description: Sunderland and Newcastle United will meet in the Premier League on Sunday for the first time in nearly a decade as "two worlds collide".

item.title: Goodbye - but only for now? Salah signs off as questions remain
item.description: Mohamed Salah's return to the Liverpool side shows boss Arne Slot is prepared to move on - but questions still remain.

item.title: Defining day of destiny awaits St Mirren & Celtic at Hampden
item.description: BBC Scotland previews the Scottish League Cup final between St Mirren and Celtic.

item.title: 'Worst 48 hours' since I joined Chelsea - Maresca
item.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says the past 48 hours are “the worst” since joining the club last summer.

item.title: Liverpool icon Rush recovering in hospital from flu
item.description: Liverpool's all-time leading goalscorer Ian Rush is recovering in hospital after spending two days in intensive care with flu.

item.title: 'We needed him' - Slot says it was 'easy decision' to recall Salah
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says it was an "easy decision" to recall forward Mohamed Salah against Brighton.

item.title: Arsenal score dramatic late winner to avoid Wolves upset
item.description: Arsenal needed a second own goal after conceding in the 90th minute to defeat bottom of the table Wolves in a enthralling end to the match.

item.title: Ekitike brace gives Liverpool important win as Salah returns
item.description: Hugo Ekitike is decisive in an important two goal win over Brighton, as Mohamed Salah marks his eagerly awaited Liverpool return with an assist.

item.title: Composed Palmer back on the scoresheet as Chelsea return to winning ways
item.description: Chelsea have moved back into the top four after defeating Everton as Cole Palmer scored for the first time since returning from injury.

item.title: Wilson stars as Fulham inflict seventh consecutive defeat on Burnley
item.description: Burnley lose crucial clash as Harry Wilson continues his fine form to send Fulham seven points clear of the drop zone.

item.title: 'Fantastic human' Russo shines in Arsenal win at Everton
item.description: England striker Alessia Russo was at the heart of Arsenal's WSL win at Everton - a reminder to doubters of how indispensable she is.

item.title: Man arrested and match postponed as non-league manager injured
item.description: A man is arrested after Potters Bar Town manager Sammy Moore is left requiring medical treatment following an altercation that led to the postponement of their match at Welling United.

item.title: Bristol Rovers sack Clarke after 10 straight losses
item.description: Bristol Rovers sack manager Darrell Clarke after a club-record run of 10 consecutive league defeats.

item.title: Ross County part ways with Docherty after 6-0 loss
item.description: Ross County part company with manager Tony Docherty by mutual consent after Saturday's 6-0 Scottish Championship defeat by Raith Rovers.

item.title: West Ham set sights on Sargent - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Josh Sargent is a target for West Ham, Manchester City are prepared to sell a trio to boost their January spending, Ibrahima Konate is attracting interest from Europe, plus more.

item.title: 'The game that really matters' - pundits on Tyne-Wear derby
item.description: Football Focus pundits Stephen Warnock and Ashley Williams look ahead to Sunday's Tyne-Wear derby between Newcastle and Sunderland.

item.title: 'He's got to be careful' - Maresca gives targeted press conference
item.description: Enzo Maresca's press conference raises questions over whether his comments are aimed at the Chelsea board.

item.title: How Arsenal are constantly a threat from crosses
item.description: Alan Shearer praises Arsenal's directness and willingness to put crosses into the box during their late win against Wolves.

item.title: Ekitike may be Liverpool's best player - Murphy
item.description: Danny Murphy discusses Liverpool's "shining light" Hugo Ekitike after the French striker's brace secures win against Brighton.

item.title: Gusto is 'star of the show' - Murphy
item.description: Danny Murphy aplauds Malo Gusto's versatility, as the defender scores and assists in Chelsea's win over Everton.

item.title: 277 and out? Liverpool's Salah turns record breaker again
item.description: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah breaks former Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney's record for the most Premier League goal involvements with his goal against Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Angry fans throw chairs and bottles at Messi event in India
item.description: The Inter Miami and Argentina forward is in India for a tour, taking in events in Kolkata, Hyderabad, Mumbai and Delhi.

item.title: 'I'm proud but it hurts' - Edwards on Wolves defeat
item.description: Rob Edwards wants his team to stay positive despite being in a "difficult moment" after their defeat against top of the table Arsenal.

item.title: Arteta glad Arsenal found a way in 'rollercoaster' win
item.description: Mikel Arteta is grateful for Arsenal's late reaction in a vital win against Wolves.

item.title: Burnley can't give up goals in 'deadly' league - Parker
item.description: Burnley boss Scott Parker urges his side to cut out defensive errors in order to succeed in the Premier League.

item.title: Silva praises Wilson in 'big' Fulham win at Burnley
item.description: Marco Silva praises "mature" Harry Wilson after important Fulham's 3-2 win against Burnley.

item.title: 'There is no issue to resolve' - Slot on Salah
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot talks about Mohamed Salah after the Egypt forward returned for their 2-0 win against Brighton.

item.title: Hurzeler says Brighton 'deserved more' from Liverpool defeat
item.description: A frustrated Fabian Hurzeler says that the goals conceded in his sides 2-0 loss away to Liverpool in the Premier League were "definitely avoidable." The Brighton manager wants improvements in the way his team starts games, as well as defending set-pieces.

item.title: No disappointment in Everton performance - Moyes
item.description: Everton boss David Moyes says it was a disappointing result but it "certainly wasn't a disappointing performance" from his side in their 2-0 defeat to Chelsea.

item.title: Playing with Salah a 'blessing' - Ekitike
item.description: Liverpool striker Hugo Ekitike tells Final Score he looks up to players like Mohamed Salah, who returned off the bench today and assisted him for his second goal against Brighton

item.title: Palmer 'makes Chelsea better' but Maresca cautious on midfielder's return
item.description: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca says his side are better with Cole Palmer in it after the England international scored against Everton but was cautious on reintroducing the midfielder too quickly following his return from injury.

item.title: 'Luck on our side' - relief from Slot after Brighton win
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says that his team had luck on their side for the first time 'in months' following a 2-0 win against Brighton in the Premier League at Anfield.

item.title: How Savage and Smethurst gave Macclesfield 'new life'
item.description: A look at how former Premier League footballer Robbie Savage and Macclesfield FC owner Rob Smethurst helped revive a football club.

item.title: Bronze's 'beautiful' chip features in UWCL goals of the week
item.description: Strikes from Lucy Bronze, Linda Caicedo and Melchie Dumornay all feature in the best goals of the week from the Women's Champions League.

item.title: Daly scores in 27 seconds as Villa put three past Liverpool
item.description: Rachel Daly scores her first two goals of the season, including one in the first 27 seconds of the match, as Aston Villa beat Liverpool 3-0 in the Women's Super League.

item.title: There are 'no reasons to not want Salah to stay' at Liverpool - Slot
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says there are "no reasons to not want Mohamed Salah to stay" at the club and will hold further talks with the forward on Friday.

item.title: I'm learning a new football language - Rashford
item.description: Marcus Rashford speaks to BBC Sport Spanish football reporter Elizabeth Conway about how he is settling into life with Barcelona.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v England Gaming star Daniel 'Stingray' Ray
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on England Gaming star Daniel 'Stingray' Ray - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Guardiola, a great generation, and dogs called John and Charles
item.description: Manchester City midfielder Bernardo Silva sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss his career, what he will do once he retires, and playing for Pep Guardiola.

item.title: Cup final victory would 'validate' Celtic process - Nancy
item.description: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy says victory in Sunday's Premier Sports Cup final against St Mirren would "validate" what he is trying to implement at his new club.

item.title: Five million World Cup ticket requests in one day - Fifa
item.description: Fifa says five million World Cup ticket requests have been made, despite coming under pressure from supporters' groups critical of its "scandalous" pricing structure.

item.title: Six players to watch at Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa picks out six players to keep an eye on at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco from 21 December to 18 January.

item.title: 'There can only be one singer' - my secrets of successful man-management
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at man-management and how dealing with unhappy players is not the only challenge a manager will face.

item.title: Which SPFL players are heading for Afcon 2025?
item.description: Ten players from seven Scottish clubs are heading to the Africa Cup of Nations, but how long will they be away and what are their prospects?

item.title: Antonio bids to relaunch career at Leicester 12 months after crash
item.description: Ex-West Ham striker Michail Antonio will be given a chance to restart his club career with Leicester City.

item.title: Rooney 'got death threats' after making Man Utd move
item.description: Former England striker Wayne Rooney says he received death threats when he made the move from boyhood club Everton to Manchester United in 2004.

item.title: 'Salah helped bring our communities together'
item.description: Liverpool's Arab community say they would be "disappointed" if the Egyptian leaves the club.

item.title: Why have managers stopped wearing suits?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team look at why managers have traded suits for tracksuits in the Premier League.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: BBC or ITV? Inside how World Cup broadcast picks are made
item.description: We now know the broadcast schedule for the 2026 World Cup, but how do BBC and ITV decide who shows which matches?

item.title: All you need to know about Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa provides all the information on the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations ahead of the 35th edition of the continent's biggest sporting event.

item.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
item.description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

item.title: Are Man Utd turning the tide or is a 'bad result just around corner'?
item.description: Manchester United moved into the Premier League top six with their biggest win of the season - but they still have to prove the doubters wrong.

item.title: Haaland v Mbappe, dream ties and YMCA - the best of the World Cup draw
item.description: YMCA, Donald Trump and Kylian Mbappe v Erling Haaland - BBC Sport runs through the best bits from the World Cup draw.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign

item.title: Which Premier League teams will lose most players to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport has a look at which Premier League clubs will be most - and least - affected by the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: How did Littler get Man Utd away tickets - and why has it sparked debate?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore how Luke Littler got Manchester United away tickets against Wolves on Monday evening.

item.title: Why is there a 15:30 Champions League match?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why there is a 15:30 GMT kick-off in the Champions League on Tuesday

item.title: What is an 'Olimpico' goal in football?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the definition of and origins behind the 'Olimpico' goal

item.title: 'It was handball, wasn't it?' - why Rutter goal against West Ham stood
item.description: Georginio Rutter's late equaliser in Brighton's 1-1 draw with West Ham on Sunday was allowed to stand despite handball claims. BBC Sport looks at the rules to explain why.

item.title: Who is Arsenal's teenage debutant Salmon?
item.description: Arsenal bring 16-year-old Marli Salmon on as a substitute against Club Brugge in the Champions League, but who is he?

item.title: English clubs chase Rangers midfielder Rothwell - gossip
item.description: Rangers midfielder Joe Rothwell could return to the English Championship in Janurary, while a Celtic-linked striker has his asking price reduced.

item.title: 'Old ladies were hanging out windows' - remembering St Mirren's 2013 League Cup win
item.description: Manager Danny Lennon and striker Steven Thompson recall St Mirren's 2013 League Cup win - from the build-up, to the match and what they can remember of the celebrations.

item.title: Hearts in talks with St Johnstone star McPake
item.description: Manager Derek McInnes says Hearts are in talks with St Johnstone winger Josh McPake about a move next summer.

item.title: Fiorentina take security measures after threats
item.description: Fiorentina say they have taken security measures to protect players, staff and their families after they receive "unacceptable and shameful" threats.

item.title: Fenerbahce captain's home raided in Turkish betting scandal
item.description: Players, club directors, a commentator and a referee are among the latest to be arrested in Turkey's betting scandal.

item.title: Unlucky own goal helps Gladbach beat Mainz
item.description: Watch highlights, as the Bundesliga's bottom side Mainz 05 suffer a narrow defeat to Borussia Monchengladbach.

item.title: Real's Courtois asks fans to stop abuse of players
item.description: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois urges supporters to show players more "respect" after team-mate Vinicius Jr is once again the target of abuse by fans.

item.title: Villa defeat 'reality check' for struggling Liverpool
item.description: Under-pressure Liverpool manager Gareth Taylor says his side have had a "real reality check" as their winless start to the Women's Super League season continues.

item.title: 'A stunning team performance' as Chelsea share goals around against Roma
item.description: Five players wrote their names on the scoresheet as Chelsea saw off Roma in the Women's Champions League.

item.title: Man Utd humbled by Lyon - but key lessons learned
item.description: Manchester United were given a demonstration of what it takes to be Europe's best on Wednesday night - but Marc Skinner hopes his side can learn from it.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
